/* America */ re-write of early history, with references

sub section merger proposal

/* Medieval and Tudor period */ re-edit, added references
/* Rebellion and creation of the document */ Unless I'm missing something, clause 61 does not say the King should swear an oath to the 25 barons.
/* Reconfirmations of the Charter */ noted last reconfirmation
/* Content */ Closer to the wording in the Charter. Magna Carta makes clear that paying a fee was traditional on inheritance. I think the charter was trying to stop additional or excessive fees.
/* Clauses in Runnymede Charter but not in later Charters */ Typo.
/* Clauses in Runnymede Charter but not in later Charters */ Delete most of Jews in England section (tangential). Paraphrase clauses 10 + 11. Delete Editor's Note (this is all the 1215 charter).
/* Clauses in Runnymede Charter but not in later Charters */ "it be lawful be" -> "it was lawful". Clarify clause 45. Separate out 61-63. Give corresponding text from 1225/1297 charter for clause 63.
/* Rebellion and creation of the document */ which->who. Ampersand in references.
Space, ampersand, quote marks, in reference.

/* Rebellion and creation of the document */ Typo.

/* Rebellion and creation of the document */ Detail on the lack of an alternative monarch, from Danziger + Gillingham.
Linking "will" seems pointless.

/* Clauses in Runnymede Charter and 1225/1297 Charter but since repealed */ Delete clause 44 and text left over from earlier version.
/* Clauses in Runnymede Charter and in 1216/1217 Charter but not in 1225/1297 Charter */ Clauses 8,9, 16.

repositioned section chronologically
